Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.polygon

Class HorizonDepth

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.polygon.Horizon
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.polygon.HorizonDepth
public class HorizonDepth extends Horizon
A Horizon representing a constant depth in the model.
Author:
sballar

  • Constructor Details

    • HorizonDepth

      public HorizonDepth(double depth)
      Constructor for a Horizon object that represents a constant depth beneath the surface of the GRS80 ellipsoid. Units are km.

      Since the layerIndex is not specified, the depth is not constrained to be within any particular layer.

      Parameters:
      depth - depth below the surface of the GRS80 ellipsoid, in km.

    • HorizonDepth

      public HorizonDepth(double depth, int layerIndex)
      Constructor for a Horizon object that represents a constant depth beneath the surface of the GRS80 ellipsoid. Units are km.

      Since the layerIndex is specified, the depth will be constrained to be within the specified layer.

      Parameters:
      depth - depth below the surface of the GRS80 ellipsoid, in km.
      layerIndex - the index of the layer within which the depth will be constrained.

    • HorizonDepth

      public HorizonDepth(DataInputStream input) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException

    • HorizonDepth

      public HorizonDepth(String record) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

  • Method Details

    • getRadius

      public double getRadius(double[] position, double[] layerRadii)
      Description copied from class: Horizon
      Return the radius of the Horizon at the specified geographic position and constrained by the specified array of radii, all of which are assumed to reside at the specified position.
      Specified by:
      getRadius in class Horizon
      Parameters:
      position - the unit vector representing the position where the radius is to be determined. This should correspond to the position of the supplied array of Profiles. Used only by HorizonDepth objects to determine the radius of the Earth at the position of the Profiles. Not used by HorizonLayer or HorizonRadius objects.
      layerRadii - a 1D array of radius values, in km, that specify the radii of the interfaces between layers, determined at the specified position. The number of elements must be equal to one plus the number of layers in the model. The first value is the radius of the bottom of the deepest layer (closest to the center of the Earth) and the last value is the radius of the top of the last layer (farthest from the center of the Earth).
      Returns:
      the radius of the Horizon at the specified position and perhaps constrained to reside in the specified layer. Units are km.

    • getValue

      public double getValue()
      Specified by:
      getValue in class Horizon
